analysisEngineMetaData.name: JCoRe Sentence Annotator
analysisEngineMetaData.description: This is the UIMA Wrapper for the JULIE Sentence Boundary Detector.

configurationParameter.name: ModelFilename
configurationParameter.description: Filename for the trained JSBD model

configurationParameter.name: Postprocessing
configurationParameter.description: Indicates whether postprocessing (and which filter) should be run. Default: no postprocessing

configurationParameter.name: SentenceDelimiterTypes
configurationParameter.description: Qualified names of types that should never begin or end within a sentence. With other words, sentences should not begin within such a type but end after it or begin before it and end within or after it.

configurationParameter.name: CutAwayTypes
configurationParameter.description: An array of fully qualified type names. Document text covered by annotations of these types will be ignored from sentence splitting. This means that sentence splitting happens as if the covered text of these annotations would not exist in the text. This helps for references, for example, which otherwise might confuse the sentence splitting. A post-processing step tries to extend sentences include such annotations if they appear directly after the sentence (e.g. references: '...as Smith et al. have shown.1 Further text follows...').

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Token
typeDescription.description: Token annotation marks the span of a token and takes all additional annotations that are on the token level, including Part-of-Speech information, lemma, stemmed form, grammatical features such as gender, number and orthographical information; furthemore, Token includes the information about dependency relations to other tokens (see correspondent annotation types for further infromation).

featureDescription.name: lemma
featureDescription.description: the lemma information, O

featureDescription.name: posTag
featureDescription.description: List contains part-of-speech tags of different part-of-speech tagsets (see also POSTag and subtypes), O

featureDescription.name: stemmedForm
featureDescription.description: Contains the stemmed form of token (see StemmedForm), O

featureDescription.name: feats
featureDescription.description: Contains grammatical features correspondent to the part-of-speech tag of current token (see GrammaticalFeats and subtypes), O

featureDescription.name: orthogr
featureDescription.description: see de.julielab.jcore.types.Orthogrpahy

featureDescription.name: depRel
featureDescription.description: Contains a list of syntactical dependencies, see DependencyRelation, O

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.POSTag
typeDescription.description: POS is a linguistic category of words (tokens) that are defined by their particular syntactic/morphological behaviours (e.g. noun, verb).

featureDescription.name: tagsetId
featureDescription.description: Every POS tagset (see subtypes) has an identifier, C

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The value of POS (NN, JJ etc.)

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.PennPOSTag
typeDescription.description: The Penn Treebank Tag Set* in Mitchell P. Marcus, Beatrice Santorini, and Mary Ann Marcinkiewicz: Building a Large Annotated Corpus of English: The Penn Treebank, in Computational Linguistics, Volume 19, Number 2 (June 1993), pp. 313--330 (Special Issue on Using Large Corpora). TagsetId 0

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.GeniaPOSTag
typeDescription.description: Genia Tag Set in Tateisi, Yuka and Jun'ichi Tsujii. (2004). Part-of-Speech Annotation of Biology Research Abstracts. In the Proceedings of 4th International Conference on Language Resource and Evaluation (LREC2004). IV. pp. 1267-1270. TagsetId 1

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.PennBioIEPOSTag
typeDescription.description: Mark A. Mandel. Integrated Annotation of Biomedical Text: Creating the PennBioIE Corpus. March 2006. Text Mining, Ontologies and Natural Language Processing in Biomedicine.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.STTSPOSTag
typeDescription.description: For general language German texts, cf. Anne Schiller, Simone Teufel, Christine Stöckert, and Christine Thielen. Guidelines für das Tagging deutscher Textcorpora mit STTS (Kleines und großes Tagset). Inst. für masch. Sprachverarbeitung, U. Stuttgart; Seminar für Sprachwissenschaft, U. Tübingen, 1999.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.STTSMedPOSTag
typeDescription.description: For German biomedical texts, cf. Joachim Wermter and Udo Hahn. An annotated German-language medical text corpus as language resource. In LREC 2004—Proceedings of the 4th International Conference on Language Resources and Evaluation, volume 2, pages 473–476, 2004.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Lemma
typeDescription.description: Lemma is the canonical form of a lexeme. Lemma can be retrieved from lexicon or be produced by lemmatizer.

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The value of lemma,C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.StemmedForm
typeDescription.description: Represents a grammatical morpheme, identifies the morpheme's base form for the current token, activat- for activation. Different forms can be produced by stemmers.

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The value of the stemmed form, C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Simplex
typeDescription.description: Represents a morpheme of a compound.

featureDescription.name: lemma
featureDescription.description: The lemma of the simplex, C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Abbreviation
typeDescription.description: An abbreviation is a letter or group of letters, taken from a word or words. For example, the word "abbreviation" can be abbreviated as "abbr." or "abbrev."

featureDescription.name: expan
featureDescription.description: The full form of an abbreviation. For example he fullform, for example for HLA (human leukocyte antigen), O

featureDescription.name: textReference
featureDescription.description: Reference to the text span that contains the full form of the abbreviation/acronym

featureDescription.name: definedHere
featureDescription.description: The definedHere is true if the abbreviation/acronym is defined for the first time in the text, e.g. in "interleukin 2 (Il-2) receptor", it can be true only for locally introduced abbreviations/acronyms.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Acronym
typeDescription.description: Abbreviation includes acronyms written as the initial letter or letters of words, and pronounced on the basis of this abbreviated written form.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.GrammaticalFeats
typeDescription.description: Describes a word structure, default grammatical features dependent of a word category, see subtypes

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.NounFeats
typeDescription.description: Describes a word structure, default grammatical features of a noun

featureDescription.name: gender
featureDescription.description: Gender, C

featureDescription.name: case
featureDescription.description: Case. C

featureDescription.name: number
featureDescription.description: Number, C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.VerbFeats
typeDescription.description: Describes a word structure, default grammatical features of a verb

featureDescription.name: tense
featureDescription.description: Tense

featureDescription.name: person
featureDescription.description: Person

featureDescription.name: number
featureDescription.description: Number

featureDescription.name: voice
featureDescription.description: Voice

featureDescription.name: aspect
featureDescription.description: Aspect

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.AdjectiveFeats
typeDescription.description: Describes a word structure, default grammatical features of a adjective

featureDescription.name: degree
featureDescription.description: Degree

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.PronounFeats
typeDescription.description: Describes a word structure, default grammatical features of pronouns

featureDescription.name: gender
featureDescription.description: Gender

featureDescription.name: case
featureDescription.description: Case

featureDescription.name: number
featureDescription.description: Number

featureDescription.name: person
featureDescription.description: Person

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Orthography
typeDescription.description: As more than one value might apply to a token, there is a StringList that can be filled with all values that apply for this token.

value.description: Every character is a lowercase letter: token
Every character is an uppercase letter: TOKEN
The first character is an uppercase letter; all other characters are lowercase letters: Token
There is more than one uppercase letter in the token: ToKEn
The token is a single uppercase letter: T
with one or more hyphens: token-token
The token is a single uppercase letter followed by a dot: T.
The token is an arithmetic or algebraic operator
The token is an opening or closing bracket, brace, parenthesis
The token is any sequence of characters that does not match any of the above descriptions

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Chunk
typeDescription.description: Results of the chunking (shallow Parsing (see Abney))

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.ChunkComplexNP
typeDescription.description: This encodes a complex noun phrase (CNP) which is usually an extension of a ChunkNP (see, e.g., jcore-cnp-extractor-ae). A CNP is currently defined to be the top-modes noun phrase of a constituency parse tree (excluding some special phrases such as appositions and SBARs).

featureDescription.name: chunkID
featureDescription.description: number of this complex NP in the given sentence

featureDescription.name: sentenceID
featureDescription.description: the number of the sentence in which this complex NP is

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.DependencyRelation
typeDescription.description: Syntactic dependency relation annotation, see subtypes

featureDescription.name: head
featureDescription.description: Head (Token) of the analyzed dependency relation, C

featureDescription.name: projective
featureDescription.description: The dependency relations can be projective or not, C

featureDescription.name: label
featureDescription.description: The label of the relation (e.g. SBJ, OBJ, DEP)

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Constituent
typeDescription.description: The super-type for the constituent annotation, see subtypes

featureDescription.name: parent
featureDescription.description: The parent in a constituency tree, C

featureDescription.name: head
featureDescription.description: The head can be extracted with head rules, O

featureDescription.name: cat
featureDescription.description: The category of the constituent (e.g. NP, VP)

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.PTBConstituent
typeDescription.description: Penn Treebank constituent annotation (see Penn Treebank)

featureDescription.name: formFuncDisc
featureDescription.description: Form/function discrepancies, O

featureDescription.name: gramRole
featureDescription.description: Grammatical role, O

featureDescription.name: adv
featureDescription.description: Adverbials are generally VP adjuncts.

featureDescription.name: misc
featureDescription.description: Miscellaneous

featureDescription.name: ref
featureDescription.description: Th reference from the null constituent to the corresponding lexicalized constituent, O

featureDescription.name: map
featureDescription.description: In the case of gapping the reference to the corresponding constituent, O

featureDescription.name: tpc
featureDescription.description: Marks elements that appear before the subject in a declarative sentence, O

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.GENIAConstituent
typeDescription.description: Ohta, Tomoko, Yuka Tateisi, Hideki Mima and Jun'ichi Tsujii. (2002). GENIA Corpus: an Annotated Research Abstract Corpus in Molecular Biology Domain. In the Proceedings of he Human Language Technology Conference (HLT 2002). pp73--77.

featureDescription.name: syn
featureDescription.description: Marks coordinations, O

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.PennBioIEConstituent
typeDescription.description: Mark A. Mandel. Integrated Annotation of Biomedical Text: Creating the PennBioIE Corpus. March 2006. Text Mining, Ontologies and Natural Language Processing in Biomedicine.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Sentence
typeDescription.description: This annotation marks the span of a sentence.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.AbbreviationLongform
typeDescription.description: This annotation type represents the text reference to an abbreviation.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Annotation
typeDescription.description: The super-type for all types.

featureDescription.name: confidence
featureDescription.description: The component that made the annotation may put its confidence/score calculated internally here, O

featureDescription.name: componentId
featureDescription.description: Indicates which NLP component has been used to derive the annotation, C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.DiscontinuousAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Chains annotations of the same type

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: Annotations to be chained.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.ResourceEntry
typeDescription.description: The reference to an external resource

featureDescription.name: source
featureDescription.description: The name of the resource, C

featureDescription.name: entryId
featureDescription.description: The identifier of the entry, C

featureDescription.name: version
featureDescription.description: The version of the resource, C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Paragraph
typeDescription.description: A paragraph is a self-contained unit of discourse in a written text dealing with a particular point or idea.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Section
typeDescription.description: a section is a part of the text that often has a heading, an id, a section type, figures, tables, citations and footnotes that occur in this section

featureDescription.name: sectionHeading
featureDescription.description: the title of the section

featureDescription.name: sectionType
featureDescription.description: the type of the section (e.g. results)

featureDescription.name: textObjects
featureDescription.description: the text objects (figure, table, boxed text etc.) that are associated with a particular section

featureDescription.name: sectionId
featureDescription.description: the id of the section, for example as mentioned in the original file, or level of the section

featureDescription.name: depth
featureDescription.description: depth of the section, e.g. 0 -> section, 1 -> subsection, 2 -> sub-subsection, ...

featureDescription.name: label
featureDescription.description: The section label, if given. This might, for example, just be the section number.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Zone
typeDescription.description: A Zone is a distinct division of text. It is an abstract Type and provides a parent type for sub-types which represent various kinds of text zones.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Title
typeDescription.description: Title annotates titles covering various text units, including the whole paper, sections and subsections.

featureDescription.name: titleType
featureDescription.description: The type of the title: table: title of a table figure: title of a figure caption: title of a caption footnote: title of a footnote

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Caption
typeDescription.description:
the caption of figures, tables etc.
feature captionTitle is a Title-Annotation of the title of the caption, if existent.
feature captionType is an Enumeration, stating to what type of entity the caption belongs, e.g. figure or table

featureDescription.name: captionTitle
featureDescription.description: The title of a figure / table caption, if it exists

featureDescription.name: captionType
featureDescription.description: The type of entity, this caption belongs to, e.g. figure or table

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.TextObject
typeDescription.description: Object, on our case, are annotations such as figures, tables, boxed text etc.

featureDescription.name: objectType
featureDescription.description: such as figure, table, boxed-text etc.

featureDescription.name: objectId
featureDescription.description: the id of the object as found in the text

featureDescription.name: objectLabel
featureDescription.description: the label of an object

featureDescription.name: objectCaption
featureDescription.description: the caption that comes with the object

featureDescription.name: objectTitle
featureDescription.description: The title annotation of the text object, if it exists. The title might correspond to the objectLabel (which is of type String and thus no annotation on its own).

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.AbstractText
typeDescription.description: Annotation of the complete abstract.

featureDescription.name: structuredAbstractParts
featureDescription.description: A List of all parts of a structured abstract. Empty, if the abstract consists of only one part and has no titles.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Style
typeDescription.description: Text-markup information (italic, bold etc.) on any (e.g. character) level. Allows to keep the original style markup of the text, several style types might be set to same (or overlapping) range, when different styles are set to the same text region.

featureDescription.name: styleName
featureDescription.description: the name of the style used.

featureDescription.name: encoding
featureDescription.description: the encoding used.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Encoding
typeDescription.description: Encoding Information

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.List
typeDescription.description: used for annotation of lists

featureDescription.name: itemList
featureDescription.description: contains items of the level 1. The items of the level 1 could contain further items of next level and so on in order to represent an iterative structure of list items.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.ListItem
typeDescription.description: item of a list

featureDescription.name: itemList
featureDescription.description: items of the next level (sub-items)

featureDescription.name: level
featureDescription.description: Level of indentation of the list item.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.SectionTitle
typeDescription.description: Title of a text section in contrast to the title of the whole document.

featureDescription.name: depth
featureDescription.description: depth of the section, e.g. 0 -> section, 1 -> subsection, 2 -> sub-subsection, ...

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Figure
typeDescription.description: Annotation for all elements in the CAS that belong to figures, e.g. figure title, figure caption etc.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Table
typeDescription.description: An annotation for CAS elements that belong to a table, e.g. table title, table caption etc.

featureDescription.name: footnotes
featureDescription.description: An array collecting all footnotes, appearing in this table

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Footnote
typeDescription.description: Footnotes of all kinds, i.e. footnotes found in running text or in tables etc.

featureDescription.name: abstractSectionHeading
featureDescription.description: The title of a part of a structured abstract, e.g. "Background", "Methods", "Results", ...

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Bibliography
typeDescription.description: The whole bibliography, beginning with a title like e.g. References or Literature and ending at the end of the last reference.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.TitleType
typeDescription.description: The type of a title: abstract: title of an abstract or abstract part table: title of a table figure: title of a figure caption: title of a caption footnote: title of a footnote abstract: title of an abstract or abstract part document: title of the document

value.description: Denotes the heading of a section of a structured abstract

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.CaptionType
typeDescription.description: The type of entity the Caption belongs to, e.g. a figure or a table

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Segment
typeDescription.description: A segment is comparable to "de.julielab.jcore.types.Section" but for medical document (e.g. discharge summaries) we want a distinction between these types

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: SecTag reference??

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.InternalReference
typeDescription.description: Used for document-internal references like literature references, footnotes etc.

featureDescription.name: reftype
featureDescription.description: The reference type: literature, figure, footnote etc.

featureDescription.name: refid
featureDescription.description: The ID of the referenced object.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.ReferenceType
typeDescription.description: The possible types of references in documents. May be used for the source as well as for the target of a reference (e.g. a number in full text may reference an item of the bibliography both of which are of the reference type ‘bibliography’.

value.description: Reference to an item of the bibliography.
Reference to a textbox or sidebar.
Reference to a list or a list item.
A reference of another type than enumerated in this type.

analysisEngineMetaData.name: JCoRe Token Annotator
analysisEngineMetaData.description: for English in the Biomedical Domain

configurationParameter.name: ModelFilename
configurationParameter.description: Filename for the trained JTBD model

configurationParameter.name: UseDocText
configurationParameter.description: Defines if sentence annotation should be taken into account.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Token
typeDescription.description: Token annotation marks the span of a token and takes all additional annotations that are on the token level, including Part-of-Speech information, lemma, stemmed form, grammatical features such as gender, number and orthographical information; furthemore, Token includes the information about dependency relations to other tokens (see correspondent annotation types for further infromation).

featureDescription.name: lemma
featureDescription.description: the lemma information, O

featureDescription.name: posTag
featureDescription.description: List contains part-of-speech tags of different part-of-speech tagsets (see also POSTag and subtypes), O

featureDescription.name: stemmedForm
featureDescription.description: Contains the stemmed form of token (see StemmedForm), O

featureDescription.name: feats
featureDescription.description: Contains grammatical features correspondent to the part-of-speech tag of current token (see GrammaticalFeats and subtypes), O

featureDescription.name: orthogr
featureDescription.description: see de.julielab.jcore.types.Orthogrpahy

featureDescription.name: depRel
featureDescription.description: Contains a list of syntactical dependencies, see DependencyRelation, O

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.POSTag
typeDescription.description: POS is a linguistic category of words (tokens) that are defined by their particular syntactic/morphological behaviours (e.g. noun, verb).

featureDescription.name: tagsetId
featureDescription.description: Every POS tagset (see subtypes) has an identifier, C

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The value of POS (NN, JJ etc.)

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.PennPOSTag
typeDescription.description: The Penn Treebank Tag Set* in Mitchell P. Marcus, Beatrice Santorini, and Mary Ann Marcinkiewicz: Building a Large Annotated Corpus of English: The Penn Treebank, in Computational Linguistics, Volume 19, Number 2 (June 1993), pp. 313--330 (Special Issue on Using Large Corpora). TagsetId 0

typeDescription.description: For general language German texts, cf. Anne Schiller, Simone Teufel, Christine Stöckert, and Christine Thielen. Guidelines für das Tagging deutscher Textcorpora mit STTS (Kleines und großes Tagset). Inst. für masch. Sprachverarbeitung, U. Stuttgart; Seminar für Sprachwissenschaft, U. Tübingen, 1999.

typeDescription.description: For German biomedical texts, cf. Joachim Wermter and Udo Hahn. An annotated German-language medical text corpus as language resource. In LREC 2004—Proceedings of the 4th International Conference on Language Resources and Evaluation, volume 2, pages 473–476, 2004.

typeDescription.description: Lemma is the canonical form of a lexeme. Lemma can be retrieved from lexicon or be produced by lemmatizer.

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The value of lemma,C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.StemmedForm
typeDescription.description: Represents a grammatical morpheme, identifies the morpheme's base form for the current token, activat- for activation. Different forms can be produced by stemmers.

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The value of the stemmed form, C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Simplex
typeDescription.description: Represents a morpheme of a compound.

featureDescription.name: lemma
featureDescription.description: The lemma of the simplex, C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Abbreviation
typeDescription.description: An abbreviation is a letter or group of letters, taken from a word or words. For example, the word "abbreviation" can be abbreviated as "abbr." or "abbrev."

featureDescription.name: expan
featureDescription.description: The full form of an abbreviation. For example he fullform, for example for HLA (human leukocyte antigen), O

featureDescription.name: textReference
featureDescription.description: Reference to the text span that contains the full form of the abbreviation/acronym

featureDescription.name: definedHere
featureDescription.description: The definedHere is true if the abbreviation/acronym is defined for the first time in the text, e.g. in "interleukin 2 (Il-2) receptor", it can be true only for locally introduced abbreviations/acronyms.

typeDescription.description: Abbreviation includes acronyms written as the initial letter or letters of words, and pronounced on the basis of this abbreviated written form.

typeDescription.description: Describes a word structure, default grammatical features dependent of a word category, see subtypes

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.NounFeats
typeDescription.description: Describes a word structure, default grammatical features of a noun

featureDescription.name: gender
featureDescription.description: Gender, C

featureDescription.name: case

featureDescription.name: number

featureDescription.name: tense

featureDescription.name: person

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Orthography
typeDescription.description: As more than one value might apply to a token, there is a StringList that can be filled with all values that apply for this token.

value.description: Every character is a lowercase letter: token
Every character is an uppercase letter: TOKEN
The first character is an uppercase letter; all other characters are lowercase letters: Token
There is more than one uppercase letter in the token: ToKEn
The token is a single uppercase letter: T
with one or more hyphens: token-token
The token is a single uppercase letter followed by a dot: T.
The token is an arithmetic or algebraic operator
The token is an opening or closing bracket, brace, parenthesis
The token is any sequence of characters that does not match any of the above descriptions

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Chunk
typeDescription.description: Results of the chunking (shallow Parsing (see Abney))

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.ChunkComplexNP
typeDescription.description: This encodes a complex noun phrase (CNP) which is usually an extension of a ChunkNP (see, e.g., jcore-cnp-extractor-ae). A CNP is currently defined to be the top-modes noun phrase of a constituency parse tree (excluding some special phrases such as appositions and SBARs).

featureDescription.name: chunkID
featureDescription.description: number of this complex NP in the given sentence

featureDescription.name: sentenceID
featureDescription.description: the number of the sentence in which this complex NP is

featureDescription.name: head

featureDescription.name: projective

featureDescription.name: label
featureDescription.description: The label of the relation (e.g. SBJ, OBJ, DEP)

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Constituent
typeDescription.description: The super-type for the constituent annotation, see subtypes

featureDescription.name: parent
featureDescription.description: The parent in a constituency tree, C

featureDescription.name: head
featureDescription.description: The head can be extracted with head rules, O

featureDescription.name: cat

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.PTBConstituent
typeDescription.description: Penn Treebank constituent annotation (see Penn Treebank)

featureDescription.name: formFuncDisc
featureDescription.description: Form/function discrepancies, O

featureDescription.name: gramRole
featureDescription.description: Grammatical role, O

featureDescription.name: adv
featureDescription.description: Adverbials are generally VP adjuncts.

featureDescription.name: misc
featureDescription.description: Miscellaneous

featureDescription.name: ref
featureDescription.description: Th reference from the null constituent to the corresponding lexicalized constituent, O

featureDescription.name: map
featureDescription.description: In the case of gapping the reference to the corresponding constituent, O

featureDescription.name: tpc
featureDescription.description: Marks elements that appear before the subject in a declarative sentence, O

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.GENIAConstituent
typeDescription.description: Ohta, Tomoko, Yuka Tateisi, Hideki Mima and Jun'ichi Tsujii. (2002). GENIA Corpus: an Annotated Research Abstract Corpus in Molecular Biology Domain. In the Proceedings of he Human Language Technology Conference (HLT 2002). pp73--77.

featureDescription.name: syn
featureDescription.description: Marks coordinations, O

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.PennBioIEConstituent
typeDescription.description: Mark A. Mandel. Integrated Annotation of Biomedical Text: Creating the PennBioIE Corpus. March 2006. Text Mining, Ontologies and Natural Language Processing in Biomedicine.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Sentence
typeDescription.description: This annotation marks the span of a sentence.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.AbbreviationLongform
typeDescription.description: This annotation type represents the text reference to an abbreviation.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Annotation
typeDescription.description: The super-type for all types.

featureDescription.name: confidence
featureDescription.description: The component that made the annotation may put its confidence/score calculated internally here, O

featureDescription.name: componentId
featureDescription.description: Indicates which NLP component has been used to derive the annotation, C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.DiscontinuousAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Chains annotations of the same type

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: Annotations to be chained.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.ResourceEntry
typeDescription.description: The reference to an external resource

featureDescription.name: source
featureDescription.description: The name of the resource, C

featureDescription.name: entryId
featureDescription.description: The identifier of the entry, C

featureDescription.name: version
featureDescription.description: The version of the resource, C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Paragraph
typeDescription.description: A paragraph is a self-contained unit of discourse in a written text dealing with a particular point or idea.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Section
typeDescription.description: a section is a part of the text that often has a heading, an id, a section type, figures, tables, citations and footnotes that occur in this section

featureDescription.name: sectionHeading
featureDescription.description: the title of the section

featureDescription.name: sectionType
featureDescription.description: the type of the section (e.g. results)

featureDescription.name: textObjects
featureDescription.description: the text objects (figure, table, boxed text etc.) that are associated with a particular section

featureDescription.name: sectionId
featureDescription.description: the id of the section, for example as mentioned in the original file, or level of the section

featureDescription.name: depth
featureDescription.description: depth of the section, e.g. 0 -> section, 1 -> subsection, 2 -> sub-subsection, ...

featureDescription.name: label
featureDescription.description: The section label, if given. This might, for example, just be the section number.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Zone
typeDescription.description: A Zone is a distinct division of text. It is an abstract Type and provides a parent type for sub-types which represent various kinds of text zones.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Title
typeDescription.description: Title annotates titles covering various text units, including the whole paper, sections and subsections.

featureDescription.name: titleType
featureDescription.description: The type of the title: table: title of a table figure: title of a figure caption: title of a caption footnote: title of a footnote

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Caption
typeDescription.description:
the caption of figures, tables etc.
feature captionTitle is a Title-Annotation of the title of the caption, if existent.
feature captionType is an Enumeration, stating to what type of entity the caption belongs, e.g. figure or table

featureDescription.name: captionTitle
featureDescription.description: The title of a figure / table caption, if it exists

featureDescription.name: captionType
featureDescription.description: The type of entity, this caption belongs to, e.g. figure or table

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.TextObject
typeDescription.description: Object, on our case, are annotations such as figures, tables, boxed text etc.

featureDescription.name: objectType
featureDescription.description: such as figure, table, boxed-text etc.

featureDescription.name: objectId
featureDescription.description: the id of the object as found in the text

featureDescription.name: objectLabel
featureDescription.description: the label of an object

featureDescription.name: objectCaption
featureDescription.description: the caption that comes with the object

featureDescription.name: objectTitle
featureDescription.description: The title annotation of the text object, if it exists. The title might correspond to the objectLabel (which is of type String and thus no annotation on its own).

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.AbstractText
typeDescription.description: Annotation of the complete abstract.

featureDescription.name: structuredAbstractParts
featureDescription.description: A List of all parts of a structured abstract. Empty, if the abstract consists of only one part and has no titles.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Style
typeDescription.description: Text-markup information (italic, bold etc.) on any (e.g. character) level. Allows to keep the original style markup of the text, several style types might be set to same (or overlapping) range, when different styles are set to the same text region.

featureDescription.name: styleName
featureDescription.description: the name of the style used.

featureDescription.name: encoding
featureDescription.description: the encoding used.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Encoding
typeDescription.description: Encoding Information

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.List
typeDescription.description: used for annotation of lists

featureDescription.name: itemList
featureDescription.description: contains items of the level 1. The items of the level 1 could contain further items of next level and so on in order to represent an iterative structure of list items.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.ListItem
typeDescription.description: item of a list

featureDescription.name: itemList
featureDescription.description: items of the next level (sub-items)

featureDescription.name: level
featureDescription.description: Level of indentation of the list item.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.SectionTitle
typeDescription.description: Title of a text section in contrast to the title of the whole document.

featureDescription.name: depth
featureDescription.description: depth of the section, e.g. 0 -> section, 1 -> subsection, 2 -> sub-subsection, ...

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Figure
typeDescription.description: Annotation for all elements in the CAS that belong to figures, e.g. figure title, figure caption etc.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Table
typeDescription.description: An annotation for CAS elements that belong to a table, e.g. table title, table caption etc.

featureDescription.name: footnotes
featureDescription.description: An array collecting all footnotes, appearing in this table

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Footnote
typeDescription.description: Footnotes of all kinds, i.e. footnotes found in running text or in tables etc.

featureDescription.name: abstractSectionHeading
featureDescription.description: The title of a part of a structured abstract, e.g. "Background", "Methods", "Results", ...

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Bibliography
typeDescription.description: The whole bibliography, beginning with a title like e.g. References or Literature and ending at the end of the last reference.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.TitleType
typeDescription.description: The type of a title: abstract: title of an abstract or abstract part table: title of a table figure: title of a figure caption: title of a caption footnote: title of a footnote abstract: title of an abstract or abstract part document: title of the document

value.description: Denotes the heading of a section of a structured abstract

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.CaptionType
typeDescription.description: The type of entity the Caption belongs to, e.g. a figure or a table

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Segment
typeDescription.description: A segment is comparable to "de.julielab.jcore.types.Section" but for medical document (e.g. discharge summaries) we want a distinction between these types

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: SecTag reference??

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.InternalReference
typeDescription.description: Used for document-internal references like literature references, footnotes etc.

featureDescription.name: reftype
featureDescription.description: The reference type: literature, figure, footnote etc.

featureDescription.name: refid
featureDescription.description: The ID of the referenced object.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.ReferenceType
typeDescription.description: The possible types of references in documents. May be used for the source as well as for the target of a reference (e.g. a number in full text may reference an item of the bibliography both of which are of the reference type ‘bibliography’.

value.description: Reference to an item of the bibliography.
Reference to a textbox or sidebar.
Reference to a list or a list item.
A reference of another type than enumerated in this type.

configurationParameter.name: modelFile
configurationParameter.description: The OpenNLP model file. This file should already include the tag dictionary by delivering it into the training process.

configurationParameter.name: tagset
configurationParameter.description: The UIMA POSTag subtype to be used for the POS annotations.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Token
typeDescription.description: Token annotation marks the span of a token and takes all additional annotations that are on the token level, including Part-of-Speech information, lemma, stemmed form, grammatical features such as gender, number and orthographical information; furthemore, Token includes the information about dependency relations to other tokens (see correspondent annotation types for further infromation).

featureDescription.name: lemma
featureDescription.description: the lemma information, O

featureDescription.name: posTag
featureDescription.description: List contains part-of-speech tags of different part-of-speech tagsets (see also POSTag and subtypes), O

featureDescription.name: stemmedForm
featureDescription.description: Contains the stemmed form of token (see StemmedForm), O

featureDescription.name: feats
featureDescription.description: Contains grammatical features correspondent to the part-of-speech tag of current token (see GrammaticalFeats and subtypes), O

featureDescription.name: orthogr
featureDescription.description: see de.julielab.jcore.types.Orthogrpahy

featureDescription.name: depRel
featureDescription.description: Contains a list of syntactical dependencies, see DependencyRelation, O

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.POSTag
typeDescription.description: POS is a linguistic category of words (tokens) that are defined by their particular syntactic/morphological behaviours (e.g. noun, verb).

featureDescription.name: tagsetId
featureDescription.description: Every POS tagset (see subtypes) has an identifier, C

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The value of POS (NN, JJ etc.)

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.PennPOSTag
typeDescription.description: The Penn Treebank Tag Set* in Mitchell P. Marcus, Beatrice Santorini, and Mary Ann Marcinkiewicz: Building a Large Annotated Corpus of English: The Penn Treebank, in Computational Linguistics, Volume 19, Number 2 (June 1993), pp. 313--330 (Special Issue on Using Large Corpora). TagsetId 0

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.GeniaPOSTag
typeDescription.description: Genia Tag Set in Tateisi, Yuka and Jun'ichi Tsujii. (2004). Part-of-Speech Annotation of Biology Research Abstracts. In the Proceedings of 4th International Conference on Language Resource and Evaluation (LREC2004). IV. pp. 1267-1270. TagsetId 1

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.PennBioIEPOSTag
typeDescription.description: Mark A. Mandel. Integrated Annotation of Biomedical Text: Creating the PennBioIE Corpus. March 2006. Text Mining, Ontologies and Natural Language Processing in Biomedicine.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.STTSPOSTag
typeDescription.description: For general language German texts, cf. Anne Schiller, Simone Teufel, Christine Stöckert, and Christine Thielen. Guidelines für das Tagging deutscher Textcorpora mit STTS (Kleines und großes Tagset). Inst. für masch. Sprachverarbeitung, U. Stuttgart; Seminar für Sprachwissenschaft, U. Tübingen, 1999.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.STTSMedPOSTag
typeDescription.description: For German biomedical texts, cf. Joachim Wermter and Udo Hahn. An annotated German-language medical text corpus as language resource. In LREC 2004—Proceedings of the 4th International Conference on Language Resources and Evaluation, volume 2, pages 473–476, 2004.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Lemma
typeDescription.description: Lemma is the canonical form of a lexeme. Lemma can be retrieved from lexicon or be produced by lemmatizer.

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The value of lemma,C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.StemmedForm
typeDescription.description: Represents a grammatical morpheme, identifies the morpheme's base form for the current token, activat- for activation. Different forms can be produced by stemmers.

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The value of the stemmed form, C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Simplex
typeDescription.description: Represents a morpheme of a compound.

featureDescription.name: lemma
featureDescription.description: The lemma of the simplex, C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Abbreviation
typeDescription.description: An abbreviation is a letter or group of letters, taken from a word or words. For example, the word "abbreviation" can be abbreviated as "abbr." or "abbrev."

featureDescription.name: expan
featureDescription.description: The full form of an abbreviation. For example he fullform, for example for HLA (human leukocyte antigen), O

featureDescription.name: textReference
featureDescription.description: Reference to the text span that contains the full form of the abbreviation/acronym

featureDescription.name: definedHere
featureDescription.description: The definedHere is true if the abbreviation/acronym is defined for the first time in the text, e.g. in "interleukin 2 (Il-2) receptor", it can be true only for locally introduced abbreviations/acronyms.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Acronym
typeDescription.description: Abbreviation includes acronyms written as the initial letter or letters of words, and pronounced on the basis of this abbreviated written form.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.GrammaticalFeats
typeDescription.description: Describes a word structure, default grammatical features dependent of a word category, see subtypes

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.NounFeats
typeDescription.description: Describes a word structure, default grammatical features of a noun

featureDescription.name: gender
featureDescription.description: Gender, C

featureDescription.name: case
featureDescription.description: Case. C

featureDescription.name: number
featureDescription.description: Number, C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.VerbFeats
typeDescription.description: Describes a word structure, default grammatical features of a verb

featureDescription.name: tense
featureDescription.description: Tense

featureDescription.name: person
featureDescription.description: Person

featureDescription.name: number
featureDescription.description: Number

featureDescription.name: voice
featureDescription.description: Voice

featureDescription.name: aspect
featureDescription.description: Aspect

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.AdjectiveFeats
typeDescription.description: Describes a word structure, default grammatical features of a adjective

featureDescription.name: degree
featureDescription.description: Degree

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.PronounFeats
typeDescription.description: Describes a word structure, default grammatical features of pronouns

featureDescription.name: gender
featureDescription.description: Gender

featureDescription.name: case
featureDescription.description: Case

featureDescription.name: number
featureDescription.description: Number

featureDescription.name: person
featureDescription.description: Person

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Orthography
typeDescription.description: As more than one value might apply to a token, there is a StringList that can be filled with all values that apply for this token.

value.description: Every character is a lowercase letter: token
Every character is an uppercase letter: TOKEN
The first character is an uppercase letter; all other characters are lowercase letters: Token
There is more than one uppercase letter in the token: ToKEn
The token is a single uppercase letter: T
with one or more hyphens: token-token
The token is a single uppercase letter followed by a dot: T.
The token is an arithmetic or algebraic operator
The token is an opening or closing bracket, brace, parenthesis
The token is any sequence of characters that does not match any of the above descriptions

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Chunk
typeDescription.description: Results of the chunking (shallow Parsing (see Abney))

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.ChunkComplexNP
typeDescription.description: This encodes a complex noun phrase (CNP) which is usually an extension of a ChunkNP (see, e.g., jcore-cnp-extractor-ae). A CNP is currently defined to be the top-modes noun phrase of a constituency parse tree (excluding some special phrases such as appositions and SBARs).

featureDescription.name: chunkID
featureDescription.description: number of this complex NP in the given sentence

featureDescription.name: sentenceID
featureDescription.description: the number of the sentence in which this complex NP is

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.DependencyRelation
typeDescription.description: Syntactic dependency relation annotation, see subtypes

featureDescription.name: head
featureDescription.description: Head (Token) of the analyzed dependency relation, C

featureDescription.name: projective
featureDescription.description: The dependency relations can be projective or not, C

featureDescription.name: label
featureDescription.description: The label of the relation (e.g. SBJ, OBJ, DEP)

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Constituent
typeDescription.description: The super-type for the constituent annotation, see subtypes

featureDescription.name: parent
featureDescription.description: The parent in a constituency tree, C

featureDescription.name: head
featureDescription.description: The head can be extracted with head rules, O

featureDescription.name: cat
featureDescription.description: The category of the constituent (e.g. NP, VP)

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.PTBConstituent
typeDescription.description: Penn Treebank constituent annotation (see Penn Treebank)

featureDescription.name: formFuncDisc
featureDescription.description: Form/function discrepancies, O

featureDescription.name: gramRole
featureDescription.description: Grammatical role, O

featureDescription.name: adv
featureDescription.description: Adverbials are generally VP adjuncts.

featureDescription.name: misc
featureDescription.description: Miscellaneous

featureDescription.name: ref
featureDescription.description: Th reference from the null constituent to the corresponding lexicalized constituent, O

featureDescription.name: map
featureDescription.description: In the case of gapping the reference to the corresponding constituent, O

featureDescription.name: tpc
featureDescription.description: Marks elements that appear before the subject in a declarative sentence, O

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.GENIAConstituent
typeDescription.description: Ohta, Tomoko, Yuka Tateisi, Hideki Mima and Jun'ichi Tsujii. (2002). GENIA Corpus: an Annotated Research Abstract Corpus in Molecular Biology Domain. In the Proceedings of he Human Language Technology Conference (HLT 2002). pp73--77.

featureDescription.name: syn
featureDescription.description: Marks coordinations, O

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.PennBioIEConstituent
typeDescription.description: Mark A. Mandel. Integrated Annotation of Biomedical Text: Creating the PennBioIE Corpus. March 2006. Text Mining, Ontologies and Natural Language Processing in Biomedicine.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Sentence
typeDescription.description: This annotation marks the span of a sentence.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.AbbreviationLongform
typeDescription.description: This annotation type represents the text reference to an abbreviation.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Annotation
typeDescription.description: The super-type for all types.

featureDescription.name: confidence
featureDescription.description: The component that made the annotation may put its confidence/score calculated internally here, O

featureDescription.name: componentId
featureDescription.description: Indicates which NLP component has been used to derive the annotation, C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.DiscontinuousAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Chains annotations of the same type

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: Annotations to be chained.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.ResourceEntry
typeDescription.description: The reference to an external resource

featureDescription.name: source
featureDescription.description: The name of the resource, C

featureDescription.name: entryId
featureDescription.description: The identifier of the entry, C

featureDescription.name: version
featureDescription.description: The version of the resource, C

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Paragraph
typeDescription.description: A paragraph is a self-contained unit of discourse in a written text dealing with a particular point or idea.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Section
typeDescription.description: a section is a part of the text that often has a heading, an id, a section type, figures, tables, citations and footnotes that occur in this section

featureDescription.name: sectionHeading
featureDescription.description: the title of the section

featureDescription.name: sectionType
featureDescription.description: the type of the section (e.g. results)

featureDescription.name: textObjects
featureDescription.description: the text objects (figure, table, boxed text etc.) that are associated with a particular section

featureDescription.name: sectionId
featureDescription.description: the id of the section, for example as mentioned in the original file, or level of the section

featureDescription.name: depth
featureDescription.description: depth of the section, e.g. 0 -> section, 1 -> subsection, 2 -> sub-subsection, ...

featureDescription.name: label
featureDescription.description: The section label, if given. This might, for example, just be the section number.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Zone
typeDescription.description: A Zone is a distinct division of text. It is an abstract Type and provides a parent type for sub-types which represent various kinds of text zones.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Title
typeDescription.description: Title annotates titles covering various text units, including the whole paper, sections and subsections.

featureDescription.name: titleType
featureDescription.description: The type of the title: table: title of a table figure: title of a figure caption: title of a caption footnote: title of a footnote

typeDescription.description:
the caption of figures, tables etc.
feature captionTitle is a Title-Annotation of the title of the caption, if existent.
feature captionType is an Enumeration, stating to what type of entity the caption belongs, e.g. figure or table

featureDescription.name: captionTitle
featureDescription.description: The title of a figure / table caption, if it exists

featureDescription.name: captionType
featureDescription.description: The type of entity, this caption belongs to, e.g. figure or table

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.TextObject
typeDescription.description: Object, on our case, are annotations such as figures, tables, boxed text etc.

featureDescription.name: objectType
featureDescription.description: such as figure, table, boxed-text etc.

featureDescription.name: objectId
featureDescription.description: the id of the object as found in the text

featureDescription.name: objectLabel
featureDescription.description: the label of an object

featureDescription.name: objectCaption
featureDescription.description: the caption that comes with the object

featureDescription.name: objectTitle
featureDescription.description: The title annotation of the text object, if it exists. The title might correspond to the objectLabel (which is of type String and thus no annotation on its own).

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.AbstractText
typeDescription.description: Annotation of the complete abstract.

featureDescription.name: structuredAbstractParts
featureDescription.description: A List of all parts of a structured abstract. Empty, if the abstract consists of only one part and has no titles.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Style
typeDescription.description: Text-markup information (italic, bold etc.) on any (e.g. character) level. Allows to keep the original style markup of the text, several style types might be set to same (or overlapping) range, when different styles are set to the same text region.

featureDescription.name: styleName
featureDescription.description: the name of the style used.

featureDescription.name: encoding
featureDescription.description: the encoding used.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Encoding
typeDescription.description: Encoding Information

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.List
typeDescription.description: used for annotation of lists

featureDescription.name: itemList
featureDescription.description: contains items of the level 1. The items of the level 1 could contain further items of next level and so on in order to represent an iterative structure of list items.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.ListItem

featureDescription.name: itemList

featureDescription.name: level
featureDescription.description: Level of indentation of the list item.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.SectionTitle
typeDescription.description: Title of a text section in contrast to the title of the whole document.

featureDescription.name: depth
featureDescription.description: depth of the section, e.g. 0 -> section, 1 -> subsection, 2 -> sub-subsection, ...

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Figure
typeDescription.description: Annotation for all elements in the CAS that belong to figures, e.g. figure title, figure caption etc.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Table

featureDescription.name: footnotes

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Bibliography
typeDescription.description: The whole bibliography, beginning with a title like e.g. References or Literature and ending at the end of the last reference.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.TitleType
typeDescription.description: The type of a title: abstract: title of an abstract or abstract part table: title of a table figure: title of a figure caption: title of a caption footnote: title of a footnote abstract: title of an abstract or abstract part document: title of the document

value.description: Denotes the heading of a section of a structured abstract

typeDescription.description: The type of entity the Caption belongs to, e.g. a figure or a table

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.Segment

featureDescription.name: value

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.InternalReference
typeDescription.description: Used for document-internal references like literature references, footnotes etc.

featureDescription.name: reftype
featureDescription.description: The reference type: literature, figure, footnote etc.

featureDescription.name: refid
featureDescription.description: The ID of the referenced object.

typeDescription.name: de.julielab.jcore.types.ReferenceType
typeDescription.description: The possible types of references in documents. May be used for the source as well as for the target of a reference (e.g. a number in full text may reference an item of the bibliography both of which are of the reference type ‘bibliography’.

analysisEngineMetaData.name: JCoRe Pipeline AAE
analysisEngineMetaData.description: This AAE descriptor directly contains the analysis engines added through the JCoRe pipeline builder. The AAE serves to bundle all the components together.
